Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Dating: 2ND INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not after); MIDDLE KINGDOM (not before)
Name: Scarab
Description: Very well fashioned scarab, with all anatomical features depicted (head and clypeus), which was inserted into a necklace. It makes mention of the "King of Upper and Lower Egypt" above the signs Ankh ("life") and djed ("stability").
